body_html: Our policy so far has been only to document the features that we intend to support in TensorFlow long-term. Currently we use python-gflags as the implementation for tf.flags, but this is subject to change in future. In the meantime, the documentation for that library is the best source of usage information.
body_text: Our policy so far has been only to document the features that we intend to support in TensorFlow long-term. Currently we use python-gflags as the implementation for tf.flags, but this is subject to change in future. In the meantime, the documentation for that library is the best source of usage information.
body: Our policy so far has been only to document the features that we intend to support in TensorFlow long-term. Currently we use [`python-gflags`](https://github.com/gflags/python-gflags) as the implementation for `tf.flags`, but this is subject to change in future. In the meantime, the [documentation for that library](https://github.com/gflags/python-gflags/blob/master/gflags.py) is the best source of usage information.
